snippet: Shell, facing criticism for making a big deal at a time of low oil prices, is portraying the deal for BG as an opportunity to streamline its own portfolio.
abstract: Royal Dutch Shell says that its $70 billion acquisition of BG Group will yield billions in savings and expand its operations in liquefied natural gas industry, popular alternative to other fossil fuels.
lead_paragraph: Shell, facing criticism for making a big deal at a time of low oil prices, is portraying the deal for BG as an opportunity to streamline its own portfolio.

headline.main: Shell to Focus on Liquefied Natural Gas in Deal for BG Group
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Shell Says Buying BG Group Will Yield Billions in Savings
